attributes.action: Make MP's salary to be the equal to average wage of the constituency they represent.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Quite simply, MP's can only be paid an average salary of the constituency that they represent. 

 i.e. if there are 200,000 people in a constituency and total yearly gross earnings for that constituency is £10,000,000,000 then the MP's salary would be £50,000 per annum.

Simple and effective.

rejection.details: The Prime Minister and Government do not control the pay or allowances of MPs - the current system is administered by the House of Commons. Therefore the Number 10 website can not accept petitions relating to MPs’ pay or expenses.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
